result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:46 AM Defendant Joseph Duane Wright in court by video with attorney Kevin M Smith by video. David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Jacob Diaz of the Rock County Sheriff's Office sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.

records.addlTxt: Kevin Smith
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:44 PM Defendant Joseph Duane Wright in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Kevin M Smith by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $1250 Signature bond with conditions: No intentional contact with Deputy Diaz and Officer Tway. Absolute sobriety. Take all medication as prescribed. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
